answers.answer: It's VERY unlikely.  I am SO SORRY for your loss.I ws prescribed percs throughout my entire pregnancy by a nationally accredited peri-nat6al spcialist who is always featured in the New Yorker as one of the countries best doctros and I trust him completely.  If there was even trhe slightest chance that something like this could have happend he never would have prescribed them to me.  A lot of pregnant women are prescribed narcotic pain killers because, believ it or not, they are safer than ibuprofen and aspirin.Again, I am so sorry.   How far along was she?

oh my god. thats so sad! Im also very sorry for that happening. I dont think it was from the percocet though.  and 36 weeks...what a long time to be expecting and then......well....that....im sorry. :(

First off I am so sorry....the loss of an baby is always unbearably heartbreaking!  I can say with almost certainty that this was not an allergic rxn to Percocet....did they give the mother any indication as to what caused the demise?  Could have been so many things: a cord accident, congenital issues, did mom have any high risk issues (diabetes/ hypertension/blood disorder/Rh incompatibility)?  I'm sure knowing will not take the pain away and sometimes they may not be able to determine the reason. My deepest sympathy to you and your family.

The baby had an autopsy 2 days ago and we're waiting for the results.  The mother was perfectly healthy and so was the baby as far as the doctors could see with an ultrsound and heartbeat monitor until this past monday morning.

I don't want to pry or add insult to injury but did mom notice a decrease in movement of the baby prior to this? (I'm an L&D/Prenatal testing nurse) How much and how long was mom taking Percocet?  That really should not have been a factor unless Mom had a known drug allergy.

question: I have a situation.  A pregnant woman was given percocet for pain and the full term baby died in uteral.  The baby's skin was peeled off.  Does anyone know if this could have been a side effect or allergic reaction of the percocet?  The baby is my grand baby.
title: Percocet and the newborn
